The story revolves around a group of people who live in a house with lots of holes in the walls. When one of them dies, he goes to the living room. He wakes up in his bed next to a mirror. One night, when he wakes back up, the mirror is still there, but he doesn't know why. So, instead of going to sleep, they go to his room and watch some movies. Then, after a while, another person comes out of the house, and they find out that this person is a member of a band called "The Living Dead." Well, you guessed it, this guy is actually from the band. In fact, we don't even need to see what happens to him. All we have to do is open the door and enter his bedroom.

... for those of you that haven't heard of it. It's the story of a young boy who falls in love with a girl he doesn't know, and then decides to get involved with her. However, when he discovers that she is pregnant, he starts thinking more about his life than he thought he was going to. In fact, there's so much more to this film than meets the eye. The characters are so different from one another that it's hard to tell if they're the same person or not. There are a lot of scenes that seem like they've been shot on location, such as the wedding scene where the main character takes off his clothes and goes topless, etc. All in all, this is one of the best films I've seen in a long time. Highly recommended.
